column4: No one in #winehq to help.  anyone here able to help?  Winecfg displays following error: Application tries to create a window, but no driver could be loaded.
Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
I get the following error when running winecfg: Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
No one in #winehq to help.  Anyone here able to help?  I get the following error when running winecfg: Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
No one in #winehq to help.  Anyone here able to help?  I get the following error when running winecfg: Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
how are you running it?
where are you running it from?
from a terminal.  normal user
logout, then login again to gnome.
you mean reboot?
no, restart X. hit ctrl+alt+backspace
and how do i get back?
type 'gdm' -- it should take you back to the login screen automatically. If it takes you to the console, just type 'gdm'.
same error
are you running a standard installation? nothing custom?
its totally custom
I followed the world of warcraft instructions wiki
I meant, your X setup.
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BuildingWineFromSource
no idea what you mean about x setup
by the way, I had WoW running under Wine on X, but due to the lame drivers from ATI, I didn't use it.
do you mean my xorg.conf file?
no, but I don't know what could be your problem. I compiled wine from source (but not using that wiki article). It worked for me so I don't know what you did there.
no idea what to do then?
